title: 1000 Points
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"An "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-gon is a polygon with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" sides."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider a 1000-gon that is convex and has all its 1000 vertices on a circle. Let the internal angles of this polygon (in degrees) be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_1, a_2, \ldots, a_{999}, a_{1000}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in that order. Then what is the sum of all the odd-numbered values: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_1+a_3+a_5+\cdots+a_{997}+a_{999}?"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/pQJ95qdSIq-group-9.svg?width=200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If you believe that the sum varies with the shape of the polygon, enter 0. If you believe it is constant, just enter the sum."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":""}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"text","text":"Hint:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" Here is a diagram for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=6."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Now, do it for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=1000."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/rtSLy7Avzx-1.png?width=1200"}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"text","text":"Solution 1","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Divide the polygon into cyclic quadrilaterals."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There will be two on the ends, similar to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ABCD"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AFGH"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"then a total of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac12(1000-6)=497"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" quadrilaterals of the type "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ADEF"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", each with one vertex at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Within each quadrilateral, the sum of the angles at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and at the point opposite point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" will be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"180^\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Together all the angles at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" will add up to the angle "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BAH"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"the angles opposite will add up to the rest of “every other” angle along the perimeter."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sum in degrees "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=(2+497)\times 180^\circ=\boxed{89820}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"..."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/f3kLVYqisT-2.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Solution 2","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Treat all angles which are to be added equally from the start."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be one of the angles to be added. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Corresponding central angle is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=2a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c=360^\circ-b=360^\circ-2a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=\frac12(360^\circ-c)=180-\frac c2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sum of all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"’s, and there are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1000}2=500"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of them, is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"500\times180^\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" minus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac12"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" sum of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"’s."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The sum of all angles "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c=360^\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sum of all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"’s "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=500\times180^\circ-\frac12 \times360^\circ=\boxed{89820}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1000 Prisoners in a cell
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There are 1000 cells in a prison.Each cell has a prisoner. When i divide all the cell by a number (starting with 1 to 1000) and if the remainder is 0, then the door will be inverted (i.e. if it's close then it will open or vice versa). When i keep those cells on dividing till 1000, at last how many cells will be opened?
Initially all doors are closed.....
Let's take an example:-
if i divide all the cells(1 to 1000) by 1,then remainder will be 0 for all cells. Therefore every cell will open.Now, if i divide again by 2 then only even number's cell will close.I continue this process till 1000...How many cells are open????"}]}]}

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Any number (prime or not) can be written as product of 2 different numbers."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

12=1x12
     =2x6
     =3x4"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So 12 will switch 6 times on:
1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"But we can notice that square numbers will switch odd times.
Say "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"36=1x36
     =2x18
     =3x12
     =4x9
     =6x6"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So 36 will switch 9 times on:
1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 36"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Between 1&1000, 31 squares are there
(31²=961)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So answer=31"}]},{"type":"text","text":"
